intro: Hieracium oppletiforme subsp. oppletum, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense mats. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its smaller, more compact growth form compared to other members of the species.
